BusinessUnit.title: BusinessUnit
BusinessUnit.description: Represents a business unit within the Shetue Group.

id.description: Unique identifier for the BusinessUnit entity.

name.description: The canonical name of the business unit (e.g., 'Setu Filling Station').

aliases.description: Alternative names or abbreviations for the business unit (e.g., ['fuel station', 'the pump']).

Metric.title: Metric
Metric.description: Represents a measurable quantity or indicator for a specific business unit.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Metric entity.

businessUnitId.description: Reference to BusinessUnit. (Relationship: BusinessUnit 1:N Metric). Indicates which business unit this metric belongs to.

description.description: A description of what the metric is.

Dashboard.title: Dashboard
Dashboard.description: Represents a dashboard configuration, including the widgets and layout.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Dashboard entity.

layout.description: The layout configuration of the dashboard (e.g., JSON string).

Widget.title: Widget
Widget.description: Represents a single widget on a dashboard, displaying a specific metric.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Widget entity.

dashboardId.description: Reference to Dashboard. (Relationship: Dashboard 1:N Widget). Indicates which dashboard this widget belongs to.

metricId.description: Reference to Metric. (Relationship: Metric 1:N Widget). The metric displayed by this widget.

visualization.description: The type of visualization used for the widget (e.g., 'line', 'bar').

position.description: The position of the widget on the dashboard (e.g., JSON string with coordinates).

timeframe.description: The default timeframe for this widget (e.g., 'past_30d').

Alert.title: Alert
Alert.description: Represents an alert rule that triggers when a specific condition is met.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Alert entity.

businessUnitId.description: Reference to BusinessUnit. (Relationship: BusinessUnit 1:N Alert). The business unit to monitor.

metricId.description: Reference to Metric. (Relationship: Metric 1:N Alert). The metric to monitor.

conditionOperator.description: The operator used in the alert condition (e.g., '<', '>').

conditionValue.description: The value used in the alert condition.

durationMinutes.description: The duration (in minutes) for which the condition must be true before the alert is triggered.

notifyChannels.description: The channels to use for sending notifications (e.g., ['telegram', 'email']).

severity.description: The severity level of the alert (e.g., 'low', 'medium', 'high').

description.description: A description of what the alert is monitoring.

Employee.title: Employee
Employee.description: Represents an employee with access to the ExecuDash application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Employee entity.

name.description: The full name of the employee.

email.description: The email address of the employee.

role.description: The role of the employee within the organization (e.g., 'admin', 'manager', 'analyst').

businessUnitIds.description: References to BusinessUnits. (Relationship: Employee N:N BusinessUnit). The business units the employee has access to.

RawMaterial.title: RawMaterial
RawMaterial.description: Represents a raw material for the bricks business.

ProductionBatch.title: ProductionBatch
ProductionBatch.description: Represents a production batch of bricks.

FinishedGood.title: FinishedGood
FinishedGood.description: Represents a grade of finished bricks.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to support the new Bricks ERP module. It introduces collections for RawMaterials, ProductionBatches, and FinishedGoods, which are essential for tracking the manufacturing lifecycle. Each collection is structured with a clear schema and path, ensuring that data is organized logically and can be easily queried by the application. This structure aligns with Firestore's best practices for data modeling.
